CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many stages are there in this funnel chart?

SRP.Q: Is the Technical Interview stage positioned above or below the Offer Accepted stage?
SRP.A: The Technical Interview stage is positioned {above} the Offer Accepted stage.

VPR.Q: What pattern does the data reduction follow in this funnel chart?
VPR.A: The data reduction follows a {linear} pattern.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Phone Screen?
VE.A: The value of stage Phone Screen is {73%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Offer Extended?
VE.A: The value of stage Offer Extended is {31%}.

VE.Q: What is the value of stage Application Submitted?
VE.A: The value of stage Application Submitted is {87%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the highest value is Job Posting Viewed, with a value of {100%}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value in the funnel chart?
EVJ.A: The stage with the lowest value is Offer Accepted, with a value of {20%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Application Submitted to stage Phone Screen is {14%}.

SC.Q: What is the percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended?
SC.A: The percentage reduction from stage Technical Interview to stage Offer Extended is {14%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value exceed 93%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall below 52%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Technical Interview} stage has {45%}, the {Offer Extended} stage has {31%}, the {Offer Accepted} stage has {20%}.

NF.Q: In which stages of the funnel chart does the value fall between 38% and 80%? Please list the stage labels and corresponding values.
NF.A: The {Phone Screen} stage has {73%}, the {HR Interview} stage has {59%}, the {Technical Interview} stage has {45%}.

NC.Q: Which reduction is greater: from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted, or from stage Job Posting Viewed to Application Submitted?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Job Posting Viewed} to {Application Submitted} is greater.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage Job Posting Viewed to Application Submitted, from stage Phone Screen to HR Interview, or from stage Offer Extended to Offer Accepted?
NC.A: The reduction from stage {Phone Screen} to stage {HR Interview} is the greatest.

NC.Q: Which reduction is the greatest: from stage HR Interview to Technical Interview, from stage Application Submitted to Phone Screen, or from stage Technical Interview to Offer Extended?
NC.A: The reductions from stage {HR Interview} to {Technical Interview}, {Application Submitted} to {Phone Screen}, and {Technical Interview} to {Offer Extended} are equal.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the largest?
MSR.A: The largest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Application Submitted} and {Phone Screen} stages.

MSR.Q: Between which two consecutive stages in the funnel chart is the conversion rate drop the smallest?
MSR.A: The smallest drop in conversion rate occurs between the {Offer Extended} and {Offer Accepted} stages.
